alert.note: Alert for Northwest Deserts; Northwest Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 16 at 4:52AM MST until March 16 at 8:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: .Even though the threat of heavy rain is over stream flows in rivers will continue to run elevated. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST/4 PM PDT/ THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by yesterdays rain and snowmelt. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arizona and Nevada, including the following areas, in northwest Arizona, Northwest Deserts and Northwest Plateau. In Nevada, Lincoln County and Northeast Clark County. * WHEN...Until 4 PM MST/4 PM PDT/ this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rivers and streams within the watch area continue to run higher than normal. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
